remarks: If two structures have the same components (properties), one is a left module iff the other one is.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Jun-2015.)
statement:
lmodpropd.1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
lmodpropd.2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
lmodpropd.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
lmodpropd.4 $e |- ( ph -> F = ( Scalar ` K ) ) $.
lmodpropd.5 $e |- ( ph -> F = ( Scalar ` L ) ) $.
lmodpropd.6 $e |- P = ( Base ` F ) $.
lmodpropd.7 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. P /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .s ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .s ` L ) y ) ) $.
lmodpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( K e. LMod <-> L e. LMod ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d ph x y $.
